meanings.sent1: The surgeon will be reimplanting the tooth in your mouth.
meanings.sent2: She is reimplanting the flower in a bigger pot for better growth.
meanings.sent3: After the mix-up, the gardener had to reimplant the flowers in the correct order.
meanings.sent4: The idea of reimplanting old memories can be both comforting and challenging.
meanings.sent5: Reimplanting the tree in the backyard made the whole garden come to life.

meanings.definition: The act of planting something again.
meanings.sent1: The reimplanting of seeds is essential for a successful harvest.
meanings.sent2: The reimplanting of trees after a storm is a common practice in forestry.
meanings.sent3: The reimplanting of the flag in the garden marked the beginning of a new season.
meanings.sent4: The reimplanting of traditions in the community brought a sense of unity.
meanings.sent5: Her passion for reimplanting old plants inspired others to do the same in their gardens.
